section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The vehicle manufacturer offers various services that can help to make mobility as simple as possible.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The content and scope of the services offered may vary by country and equipment. Therefore, it is possible that some of the services described in the Owner's Manual may not be offered or not yet be offered in the vehicle's country of registration.
Details on availability, General Terms and Conditions and Terms of Use, the establishment of a contract, as well as the content and scope of ConnectedDrive can be obtained as follows:

item.paragraph: In the chapter Vehicle data and data protection.
In the ConnectedDrive customer portal at www.bmw-connecteddrive.com.
At the service center.

section.paragraph: Services may be provided in the following ways:

item.paragraph: When the vehicle is ordered.
Via the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal on the Internet.
If necessary, via iDrive in the ConnectedDrive Store.

overview.overview-text: Observe when operating systems and devices

warning.paragraph: Operating the integrated information systems and communication devices while driving can distract from surrounding traffic. It is possible to lose control of the vehicle. There is a risk of accident. Only use the systems or devices when the traffic situation allows. As warranted, stop and use the systems and devices while the vehicle is stationary.

item.paragraph: Active ConnectedDrive contract.
Equipped with Intelligent Emergency Call or BMW ConnectedDrive services.
Cellular network reception must be available.
Standby state is switched on.
The corresponding consent for the transmission of the data was selected and given in the Data Protection menu.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Teleservices are services that help to maintain vehicle mobility.
Teleservices are services of the vehicle manufacturer that help to maintain vehicle mobility.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Further information on available services is available as follows:

item.paragraph: On the BMW website.
Via Hotline/Customer Support
At an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.paragraph: Teleservices can comprise the following services:

item.paragraph: Teleservice Call.
Teleservice Report.
Teleservice Battery Guard.
Your service center.
Roadside Assistance, see Owner's Manual for the vehicle.
Accident Assistance, see Owner's Manual for the vehicle.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Teleservice data on the vehicle's service notifications is sent automatically to the service center by BMW prior to the service due date. If feasible, the service center will contact the customer about arranging a service appointment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The service center can use the transmitted data to prepare for the necessary work in advance. This shortens the workshop visit.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Teleservice Report transmits technical data of the vehicle that is evaluated for the ongoing development of BMW products to BMW in regular intervals, if needed.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Teleservice Report is free of charge and is activated under specific technical prerequisites.
Neither personal data nor position data is transmitted.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: If the battery charge state falls below certain values, BMW will inform the customer or service center directly as warranted or the next time the vehicle is started.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: If warranted and feasible, the service center will contact the customer about arranging a service appointment.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: The Battery Guard Teleservice is available on a country-specific basis and when the following prerequisites are met:

item.paragraph: Certain technical prerequisites are met.
To receive information from the Battery Guard Teleservice, your contact information must be stored in the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The desired service center is saved in the vehicle. This means that the service center can be contacted directly from the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The service center can be informed automatically or manually about all reported service notifications.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: The login with the BMW ID in the vehicle has been completed.

section.title: Searching for service centers
section.paragraph: The current location of the vehicle is preselected in order to search for or change a service center. Adjust the search criteria of the current location search if necessary.

action-step.paragraph: The service centers located are displayed.
Select desired service center and confirm.

item.paragraph: Select the service center as the new service center.
Accept the service center as the destination in the BMW navigation system.

section.title: Changing service centers
section.paragraph: The following options are available for changing the service center:

item.paragraph: Via Hotline/Customer Support
From an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Where applicable, via the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal on the Internet.
Where applicable, independently via iDrive on the Control Display of the vehicle.

section.paragraph: Change service center via iDrive:

action-step.paragraph: The current service center is displayed.
Press and hold the entry to call up the context menu.
Find a new service center using the service center search.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The services and applications available in the vehicle are being updated.

action-step.paragraph: Follow the instructions on the Control Display.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Contact the hotline/customer support for information on all aspects of your vehicle.

action-step.paragraph: Select the entry for Customer Support.
The number of the hotline/customer support is displayed and a voice connection is established. If a voice connection is not established, dial the number manually.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The menu displays all notifications arriving in the vehicle in form of a list.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The following notifications can be displayed:

item.paragraph: Traffic messages.
Check Control messages.
Messages on service notifications.
Communication messages, for example e-mails, SMS text messages or reminders.
Messages, for instance from the BMW app.
Messages from the manufacturer of the vehicle, for instance technical information or important customer information.
Emergency Warning System messages.
The Emergency Warning System issues warnings about storms as well as natural catastrophes, such as earthquakes, tsunamis, tidal waves and the like.

section.paragraph: The number of notifications is additionally displayed in the status field.

action-step.paragraph: Swipe from top to bottom on the control display.
Select desired notification.

section.title: Delete notifications
section.paragraph: Messages remain until the messages have been read.
Sustained Check Control messages or messages from the vehicle manufacturer with important customer information are displayed as long as they are relevant.

action-step.paragraph: Swipe from top to bottom on the control display.
Select desired notifications.
Press long on the entry to go to the Selection menu.
Delete notification.

section.title: Settings
section.paragraph: It is possible to set which notifications are permitted and which notifications will be displayed at the start of the trip or upon completion of the trip.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired setting.

section.paragraph: In the event of Emergency Warning System notifications, an acoustic signal also sounds and the text message is shown on the control display.
Certain notification types can be hidden. The notifications are received, but no acoustic signal sounds when received.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired entry:

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The BMW Intelligent Personal Assistants allows the configuration of the range of messages that will be displayed. Depending on the situation, the desired condition can be activated.

entry.paragraph: Incoming calls and non-critical notifications are not displayed.
Private contents, such as messages, will not be displayed directly.

section.paragraph: An icon in the status information indicates the number of messages.

action-step.paragraph: Swipe from top to bottom on the control display.
Select the desired setting:

section.paragraph: ConnectedDrive services can be used to make functions or equipment available for the vehicle, for instance via the ConnectedDrive Store.

item.paragraph: Active ConnectedDrive contract.
Cellular network reception must be available.
For certain services, the vehicle must be able to determine its current position, for instance in order to receive information about the current location.
The date setting on the Control Display is current.
Active ConnectedDrive contract.
Cellular network reception must be available.
The date setting on the Control Display is current.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Various services and functions for your vehicle can be booked or purchased retroactively via the ConnectedDrive Store.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The range of services offered depends on the country. The vehicle must meet certain technical prerequisites.
Only the main user of the vehicle can book services or purchase functions.
Additional information:
BMW ID/driver profiles.

section.title: Booking or purchasing services and functions
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version, services and functions can be booked or purchased differently.
In the vehicle:

action-step.paragraph: An overview is displayed of the services or functions booked in the vehicle and those that can still be booked.
To book or purchase a service or function, follow the instructions on the control display.

section.paragraph: In the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal:

action-step.paragraph: Call up the BMW ConnectedDrive Store via the BMW website.
Select the desired service or function.

section.paragraph: Purchased services or functions are automatically transferred to the vehicle.
If necessary, services and functions must be activated in the vehicle.
Logging on to the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal on the Internet under: www.bmw-connecteddrive.com.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Messages may originate from a range of different sources.

item.paragraph: MyInfo: these messages originate from the BMW ConnectedDrive customer portal or they are sent from selected partners, such as a map provider.
BMW Info: these messages are sent by selected service centers.
Messages from the manufacturer of the vehicle, for instance, technical information or important customer information.
Messages from BMW Assist: these messages are sent by the Call Center Client.

action-step.paragraph: Current BMW messages are displayed.

section.title: Delete a message

action-step.paragraph: If necessary, select message.
Press and hold the corresponding message.
Select entry to delete.

section.paragraph: To delete multiple messages:

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired message filter.
Press and hold the corresponding message.
Confirm the deletion.
All messages of the selected filter will be deleted.

section.paragraph: Messages from the manufacturer of the vehicle with technical information or important customer information cannot be deleted.
Messages from other sources can be deleted.

section.title: Further functions
section.paragraph: Depending on the equipment and the type of message, the following functions are available for a selected message:

item.paragraph: Select the displayed address to start guidance.
Select phone number to call the contact.
Select the displayed icon to access the corresponding application.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW Assist includes various services having to do with the vehicle, e.g., customer support. The services help maintain mobility.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The offering depends on the vehicle equipment and the national-market version.
Assistance may include the following services:

item.paragraph: Accident Assistance.
Roadside Assistance.
Customer support or Customer Relations.

section.paragraph: For further information on the available services, the vehicle manufacturer recommends contacting a service center or the hotline/customer support.

section.title: Starting services

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired service.

section.paragraph: A voice connection to the selected service is established.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Remote Services enable some vehicle functions to be controlled remotely via the BMW app.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: The use of the Remote Services requires an active ConnectedDrive contract.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle is controlled via the BMW app. The BMW app is available for iOS from the Apple App Store and for Android from the Google Play Store.
The app can be used to lock and unlock the vehicle, for instance. Other functions may be available, depending on the vehicle.
Alternatively, remote control of certain functions can also be requested via the BMW ConnectedDrive Call Center.
Alternatively, remote control of certain functions can also be requested via the BMW ConnectedDrive Call Center.
